title: can someone find fault with this picture?
body:
https://i.imgur.com/1odsWFS.png

(the obvious one is not what i want to divert your attention too, there is a more subtle thing to notice) 


..
...
....
......
.......
........

(it was shacos level in relation to skarners)

replies.body: But Crestknight, if failing to farm actually meant falling behind, that would incentivize both power farming and counter jungling! Riot's worked _very_ hard this season to radically dismantle the jungle, making camp timers long enough meta junglers have a 30-60 second grace period where all their camps are down after a full clear that could only possibly be used for ganking.

The main one is there being a Skarner, Teemo, Ryze, and Shaco in the game.

As for what you're pointing out, what's the issue with Shaco's level?
shaco has 37 cs and skarner had 70..... sooo{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

> [{quoted}](name=splashmasta,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RUB0J9bx,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2017-10-03T16:32:00.060+0000)
>
> shaco has 37 cs and skarner had 70..... sooo

> [{quoted}](name=CrestKnight,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RUB0J9bx,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-10-03T16:31:14.233+0000)
>
> shaco has half the farm as skarner, but is the same level. 
> 
> shaco doesn't even have to clear his own jungle to stay on par in exp as anyone else. 
> 
> in terms of 1 kill and 1 assist over skarner, do you honestly equate that much exp as is 6~9 camps are worth?

One wraith camp is 6 CS. Four buffs and two gromps is 6 CS. Are you two saying a jungler who did the first one should have the same experience and/or gold as a jungler who did the second one?

Also, Skarner is extremely close to leveling and we have no idea how close Shaco is.

im saying a jungler who does the full path should be higher in level than the jungler who only does buffs. 

even assuming shaco never does wraiths/golems and only does solo camps the whole game...
 hes able to stay on par in exp to a jungler who does take the time to do a full clear.

> [{quoted}](name=CrestKnight,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RUB0J9bx,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2017-10-03T16:49:02.708+0000)
>
> im saying a jungler who does the full path should be higher in level than the jungler who only does buffs. 
> 
> even assuming shaco never does wraiths/golems and only does solo camps the whole game...
>  hes able to stay on par in exp to a jungler who does take the time to do a full clear.

Shaco (as a result of his KDA) has likely been ganking a lot more than the Skarner. Being near enemy minion deaths grants you experience.

> [{quoted}](name=CrestKnight,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RUB0J9bx,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2017-10-03T16:49:02.708+0000)
>
> im saying a jungler who does the full path should be higher in level than the jungler who only does buffs. 
> 
> even assuming shaco never does wraiths/golems and only does solo camps the whole game...
>  hes able to stay on par in exp to a jungler who does take the time to do a full clear.

How many camps did he steal? How many lane minions did he kill? How many lane minions did Skarner kill? How many lane minions did Shaco get experience from without killing? Skarner? And as you pointed out, he had a kill an assist over Skarner.

There are a lot of factors. Just CS and KDA is not enough to determine anything. But yes, catch-up experience is too high across the board.

shaco has half the farm as skarner, but is the same level. 

shaco doesn't even have to clear his own jungle to stay on par in exp as anyone else. 

in terms of 1 kill and 1 assist over skarner, do you honestly equate that much exp as is 6~9 camps are worth?
Idk, Vel is taking CS and feeding
